title: Youngstown Radio Reading Service
text:
The Youngstown Radio Reading Service (YRRS) is a <a href="radio%20reading%20service">radio reading service</a> located in <a href="Youngstown%2C%20Ohio">Youngstown, Ohio</a>, providing daily readings of a wide variety of topical printed materials to <a href="Blindness">blind</a> and <a href="Visual%20impairment">vision-impaired</a> people. YRRS is based at 2747 Belmont Avenue at the <a href="Goodwill%20Industries">Goodwill Industries</a> building in Youngstown. It is a member of <a href="Ohio%20Radio%20Reading%20Services">Ohio Radio Reading Services</a>, an organization of nine radio reading services throughout Ohio. A volunteer-driven operation, YRRS operates everyday from noon to 11:40 p.m.
Reception of YRRS requires a special radio receiver tuned to <a href="WYSU">WYSU</a> 88.5 FM; the receiver is provided at no cost to its vision-impaired listeners. YRRS operates with the use of WYSU's radio <a href="subcarrier">subcarrier</a>.
Funding.
Monetary support for the YRRS and other radio reading services comes from the <a href="United%20Way%20of%20America">United Way</a>, state and municipal funding, endowments, grants, corporate gifts, community service organizations, fund-raising events and listener contributions.
